snippet: Judge William G. Turtle  dismissed charges against the building’s former owner after concluding that provincial laws were not intended to cover inadvertent deaths caused by glass.
abstract: Canadian Judge William G Turtle rules that windows of Toronto office tower killed 900 birds from 2008 to 2009, but dismisses charges against building's former owner after concluding that provincial laws were not intended to cover inadvertent deaths cause by glass.
lead_paragraph: Judge William G. Turtle  dismissed charges against the building’s former owner after concluding that provincial laws were not intended to cover inadvertent deaths caused by glass.

headline.main: Canada: Ruling Says Tower’s Windows Caused Deaths of 900 Birds in Toronto
headline.print_headline: Canada: Ruling Says Tower’s Windows Caused Deaths of 900 Birds in Toronto
